thesis.description: Chlorpromazine and phenobarbital exert different effects on the avoidance response. Doses of chlorpromazine, too small to markedly affect escape from noxious stimulation, suppress or prevent the occurrence of a trained avoidance response. But phenobarbital, even at ataxic doses, does not produce this decrement. An investigation of this difference might not only elucidate the modes of action of these drugs, but might also throw some light on the mechanisms involved in the avoidance response.
thesis.creator: Posluns, Donald.
thesis.subject: Psychology.
thesis.title: Differential effects of chlorpromazine and phenobarbital on avoidance behavior.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: This work was originally undertaken to establish whether there are cells in the cerebral cortex which repolarize at different rates along their length during recovery from a discharge. This property of cortical cells was suggested by the fact that many responses to electrical stimulation of the cerebral cortex could be accounted for by the presence of such differentially-repolarizing cells in the cortex. Of these responses the paroxysmal or epileptiform afterdischarge caused by strong repetitive stimulation of the cerebral cortex seemed a likely candidate for investigation.
thesis.creator: Pinsky, Carl.
thesis.subject: Physiology.
thesis.title: Mechanisms of the paroxysmal afterdischarge.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Exothermic Reactions. The high temperatures sought in the experiments were produced by heat released from exothermic reactions. Two such reactions were used, that of thermite and that of silicon-ferric oxide. Thermite is a mixture of aluminum and iron oxide. Ferric oxide was used in the experiments because its reaction with aluminum releases more heat per gram of reactants than do those of ferrous oxide or magnetite. For complete reaction, the mixture should contain 54 parts of aluminum and 159.7 parts of ferric oxide by weight.
thesis.creator: Philpotts, John. A.
thesis.subject: Geological Sciences.
thesis.title: Experiments on thermochemical methods of producing high temperatures and pressures.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The evaporation of liquid drops into a gaseous medium is of considerable theoretical and practical interest. It is involved in a growing number of industrial processes such as spray drying, cyclone evaporation, spray crystallization, combustion of liquid fuels, and evaporative cooling, to cite only a few. It also represents the basic operation in a new high-temperature solids-gas contacting method called the Atomized Suspension Technique (1, 2, 3) in which a finely divided suspension of droplets can be passed very rapidly through a sequence of physical operations (such as evaporation and drying) followed by chemical reaction, in a single piece of equipment.
thesis.creator: Pei, David. C.
thesis.subject: Chemical Engineering.
thesis.title: Simultaneous heat and mass transfer under natural and forced convection.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: For the past twenty years, almost the whole of North America has been concerned with the widespread shortage of teachers. The Province of Quebec has not escaped this problem. One of the results of the shortage of teachers has been the issuing of emergency permits to people without teacher training, and sometimes to people with very doubtful educational background. A report published by the Institute of Education of McGill University in May, 1956, made the following statement.
thesis.creator: Pedersen, Ergil. D.
thesis.subject: Education.
thesis.title: Factors associated with the selection or rejection of teaching by high school students.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Trouver un sujet de thèse qui soit à la fois intéressant et nouveau, c'est chose difficile. Jusqu'à 1957 nous ne savions pas grand'chose sur Marcel Proust. Nous avions lu Jean Santeuil, mais nous ignorions le Proust de La Recherche. C'est en cette année-là que nous avons suivi, à l'Ecole Française d'Eté de l'Université McGill, un cours sur Proust merveilleusement donné par Mme L. Fearn, professeur à l'Université de Londres. Experte sur Proust, elle a su éveiller en nous un grand intérêt pour l'œuvre du célèbre écrivain. Si bien que, vers la fin de la session, nous avions décidé du sujet de notre thèse.
thesis.creator: Paschkulew, Boris.
thesis.subject: French.
thesis.title: Proust et la nature dans la cadre de son roman ‘A la Recherche du Temps Perdu’.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Cyanocobalamin bound to normal human gastric juice (NHGJ) or to guinea pig stomach extract (GPSE) is taken up by guinea pig ileum to a greater extent than unbound cyanocobalamin. Almost all of the cyanocobalamin taken up in the presence of GPSE is removable by washing the intestinal tissue with ethylenediaminetetraacetate (EDTA), whereas the same washing procedure removes only one third of the cyanocobalamin taken up in the presence of NHGJ. The cyanocobalamin which is removed by washing with EDTA may be the same as that which is actively absorbed by guinea pig intestine.
thesis.creator: Paranchych, William.
thesis.subject: Biochemistry.
thesis.title: Studies on the mechanism of absorption of vitamin B12 by normal and neoplastic tissues.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The origin of anorthosite has been for a long time a subject of controversy in geological literature. While most geologists agree that anorthosites are igneous rocks produced from a basic magma by some process of magmatic differentiation, others maintain that they are of metamorphic origin. One possible approach to the origin of anorthosites leads through the study of their trace elements. It is well known that some trace elements are typically concentrated in minerals formed in early stage differentiation, while others are preferentially incorporated in the late differentiates.
thesis.creator: Papezik, Vladimir. S.
thesis.subject: Geological Sciences.
thesis.title: Trace elements in anorthosites.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: This survey does not purport to be exhaustive or comprehensive. It is an introduction to the activities of ICAO, a U. N. specialized agency, in the field of air navigation facilities or services as carried out by the interested states in the North Atlantic. ICAO's programme for the international financing of services necessary to civil aviation in areas which did not receive sufficient local support for them, now comprises the series of air navigation services in Iceland, Greenland and the Faroe Islands and a network of ocean vessels in the North Atlantic.
thesis.creator: Pandya, Rajnikant.
thesis.subject: Air and Space Law.
thesis.title: Joint support arrangements for air navigation facilities in international civil aviation.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Aerodynamic heating of a swept wedge airfoil was investigated in a Mach Number 2.58 flow for various sweep angles. The 2 in. x 1 1/4 in. surface size airfoil was made of stainless steel with a sharp leading edge and a wedge angle of 22.0 degrees. The angle of attack in a plane normal to the leading edge was constant at 5 degrees, the sweep angle varied from 0 to 35 degrees in five degree increments. Forty chromel-alumel thermocouples were welded to one surface of the wedge, in order to measure the temperature distribution of the surface.
thesis.creator: Palvolgyi, Romana.
thesis.subject: Mechanical Engineering.
thesis.title: Aerodynamic heating of a swept back wedge airfoil.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The study of various aspects of the wilt diseases of plants which are caused by fungi inhabiting the vascular systems of the host plants has engaged the attention of a number of research workers for over half a century. Various theories have been proposed to explain the wilt symptoms in several species of plants, yet none can be considered to fully explain how the fungus in the vascular elements causes the plant to become diseased and die. The wilt disease caused by Fusarium oxysporum f. lycopersici (Sacc.) Snyder & Hansen is specific to the tomato, Lycopersicon app.
thesis.creator: Olsen, Orvil. A.
thesis.subject: Plant Pathology.
thesis.title: A study of the pathogenic mechanism of fusarium oxysproum F. lycopersici (Sacc.) Snyder and Hansen.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Numerous attempts have been made to classify the various types of lentic environments. None of the systems of classifying lakes, whether based on dissolved oxygen, thermal conditions, chironomid larvae or numerous other criteria, has been wholly successful, nor are they likely to be until lakes in the more inaccessable regions of the world are investigated. Welch (1941) wrote, "In fact, I am disposed to view most of them as premature and worthy of little attention." Though the volume of limnological knowledge has increased greatly since then, attempts at classification are still largely premature.
thesis.creator: Oliver, Donald. M.
thesis.subject: Zoology.
thesis.title: Arctic and subarctic lakes, with special reference to the chironomidae.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: This is a study of public-owned and privately-owned telephone systems. It compares four aspects of their operations: rates, operating costs, efficiency, and quality of service. Data covers the period from July 1957 to June 1959, or the financial years 1957 and 1958. The study is based on material obtained from four companies. Three of them are publicly owned: Manitoba Telephone System, Saskatchewan Government Telephones, and Alberta Government Telephones. All three are located in Western Canada.
thesis.creator: O’Brien, John. W.
thesis.subject: Economics and Political Science.
thesis.title: Public and privately-owned telephone systems an economic comparison.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

degree.name: Doctor of Philosophy
degree.discipline: Department of Economics and Political Science

thesis.description: Libertines of the seventeenth century vigorously disputed the conventional beliefs and systems of knowledge generally accepted in their time. Offspring of a time of transition in politics, religion and scientific knowledge, their individualism was formed and influenced by many factors in this age of shifting values. They were affected by the decline of Papal authority and the growth of national self consciousness; by Protestant interpretations of the Scriptures, and the increasing complexity and disparateness of religious dogma.
thesis.creator: Northwood, Vivienne. M.
thesis.subject: English.
thesis.title: The seventeenth century libertine in France and England: a study in contrasts.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: This thesis is concerned with the effect of connections of the semi-rigid type on the Plastic methods of structural steel design. The basic principles of Plastic Design are presented, illustrating the formation of plastic ''hinges", and their rotational properties. The beam line method for semi- rigid connections, originated by C. Batho, is shown, and a theory presented using this beam line to find the required semi- rigid connection which will transfer the hinge rotation from the beam to the connection. Experiments are described in which this theory was verified. Two connections were tested to obtain their moment-rotation characteristics. Then two statically indeterminate structures using the same types of connections were tested to demonstrate that all plastic hinges formed at the same load. Finally, the advantages of this method are discussed.
thesis.creator: Nitkin, Irving. M.
thesis.subject: Civil Engineering and Applied Mechanics.
thesis.title: Plastic steel design with semi-rigid connections.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The teaching of spelling is an important task because spelling is more than a school subject -- it is one of the most essential media of written communication. If students are to write successfully in school or in later life, they must learn to spell correctly the necessary words of their language. It is through the mastery of spelling skills and principles encountered in childhood that children learn to spell for adulthood. Thus the schools are faced with the problem of having a satisfactory spelling programme to meet the needs of the students in school and in later life.
thesis.creator: Neville, Jean. D.
thesis.subject: Education.
thesis.title: The development of the spelling programme in protestant schools in Quebec from 1900 to 1960.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: A survey of Table of Isotopes, published in 1958 by Strominger, Hollander and Seaborg / 64 /, will reveal on first glance in the area of the neutron-deficient isotopes near number 180 that much information, and in particular, decay schemes and disintegration energies, are missing. This applies for ytterbium, Yb166 and Yb167, lutetium, Lu169, 171, Lu174, 178/9, hafnium, Hf170, 171, 172, 173, tantalum, Ta173, 174, 175, and tungsten, W176, 177, 178, 179.
thesis.creator: Nebesar, Boris.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: The radiochemical purification of tantalum and its spallation products by a fusion method.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The primary concern of this thesis is the consideration of the sermons of Gerard Manley Hopkins as literature, that is, their style, structure, thought, the sermons as written. But any sermon involves more than these things: it involves the success or failure as communicated in preaching; and it involves the approach to the difficulties or sermon conventions. These cannot be entirely separated from the main study, but they will be taken for granted from time to time.
thesis.creator: Napier, Murray. P.
thesis.subject: English.
thesis.title: A study of the sermons of Gerard Manley Hopkins.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The 19th Congress of N.U., which was held in Palembang the latter part of April, 1952, was a decisive one. It turned the page in the history of the development of the N. U. It represented a breaking point in the tradition of the movement which had been held for a quarter of a century. The N.U., until then purely a social, educational and religious Islamic movement, now became also a political party. It now became itself like a miniature structure of Islam which embraces every aspect of Life.
thesis.creator: Naim, Mochtar.
thesis.subject: Islamic Studies.
thesis.title: The Nahdlatul-Ulama party (1952-1955). An inquiry into the origin of its electrical success.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The aim of this thesis is to answer the following question: Did the saying about disciples, outsiders, and the mystery of the Kingdom of God originate with Jesus; and if so, what did he intend by it? Phrased in another fashion, this inquiry concerns the authenticity and meaning of Mark 4:11-12. In reality there are two questions, but the latter grows out of the former if the former receives an affirmative answer. Even if the question about authenticity were to receive a negative answer, the investigator would find it necessary to account for the saying, its meaning, and intention, though of course these would not then be ascribed to Jesus.
thesis.creator: Myers, William. R.
thesis.subject: Divinity.
thesis.title: Disciples, outsiders, and the secret of the Kingdom: Interpreting Mark 4:10-13.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: This thesis is concerned with an exploratory study and analysis of the recreational and informal educational experiences of a sample of ten juvenile delinquents selected from the Girls' Cottage School. The purpose of the study is to examine the sample's recreational experiences with a view to drawing implications for the role of recreational and informal educational agencies in delinquency prevention.
thesis.creator: Morse, Mary.
thesis.subject: Social Work.
thesis.title: Some recreational experiences of delinquents.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: This thesis presents the results of a reconnaissance seismic program carried out by the Geophysics Division of the Geological Survey of Canada during the months April to August, 1960, in the Queen Elizabeth Islands, N. W. T. The seismic investigations were a part of a continuing, comprehensive, Arctic research program directed by the Polar Continental Shelf Project (P.C.S.P.). The P.C.S.P. was created by a Federal Cabinet directive in 1959 and is a division of the Department of Mines and Technical Surveys. The seismic operations in the summer of 1960 were of a preliminary and reconnaissance nature designed to measure the thickness of the sedimentary section in as many localities as possible and to lay the foundations for detailed investigations in following years.
thesis.creator: Morrison, Huntly. F.
thesis.subject: Geological Sciences.
thesis.title: Seismic investigations in the Sverdrup Basin, Queen Elizabeth Islands.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: It may be regarded as established that exogenous estrogen administered orally or by injection induces increases in the liver lipid, liver crude protein, total liver ribonuoleic acid phosphorus (RNAP) and to a lesser extent, total liver deoxyribonucleic acid phosphorus (DNAP) of the immature fowl. Furthermore, it has been shown that estrogen induces great increases in the serum lipid. This increase in large measure represents an increase in phospholipid and it is associated with an increase in serum phosphoprotein, which is also evoked by estrogen. It is further known that estrogen induces great increases in the level of the serum calcium especially of the non-diffusible traction.
thesis.creator: Moo-Young, Alfred. J.
thesis.subject: Agricultural Chemistry.
thesis.title: Some effects of desiccated thyroid, thiouracil, progesterone and testosterone on certain responses of the sexually immature pullet to estrogen.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: A one-exchange-meson potential is derived using a modified Tamm-Dancoff approximation. This is done within the framework of a static, cut-off theory. It is round that this potential corresponds to that which would be obtained by an appropriate selection of terms in the Brillouin-Wigner perturbation series solution. The transcendental equation for the potential thus formed is then solved exactly; and this is compared with the one-meson- exchange potential of ordinary perturbation theory.
thesis.creator: Month, Melvin.
thesis.subject: Mathematics.
thesis.title: A modified Tamm-Dancoff potential for two nucleons.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: In the bibliography of this thesis, the authors are listed in alphabetical order. In the text, the references are given by the name of the author or authors and the year of publication. When the same author or authors published two or more papers in the same year, to avoid confusion, the papers are indicated in their order of publication by adding to the year small letters of the alphabet. Thus Moore, Sandberg and Watne published two papers in 1960. The first is listed as Moore, Sandberg and Watne (1960 a), and the second as Moore, Sandberg and Watne (1960 b).
thesis.creator: Monaghan, Edmond. D.
thesis.subject: Experimental Surgery.
thesis.title: Tumour cells in the circulating blood.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.
